etymology.description: Originally 呂(呂) (lǚ, "spine/music notes") depicted two disconnected blocks of metal, interpreted as two vertebrae -> connected line added in seal script -> 呂(呂) later borrowed for phonetic use in 膂(膂) (lǚ, "spine")
etymology.interpretation: The character 膂 is a variant of 呂, originally depicting two vertebrae or blocks of metal. Over time, it was borrowed phonetically to represent 'spine.'

examples.chinese: 他挺直膂背面对困难(他挺直膂背面對困難)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tǐngzhí lǚ bèi miànduì kùnnán.
examples.english: He straightens his spine to face difficulties.

examples.chinese: 经过锻炼(經過鍛鍊)，他的膂更加韧性十足(他的膂更加韌性十足)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò duànliàn, tā de lǚ gèngjiā rènxìng shízú.
examples.english: After training, his spine becomes remarkably resilient.

examples.chinese: 他虽受重伤(他雖受重傷)，却依靠坚韧的膂挺直身体(卻依靠堅韌的膂挺直身體)。
examples.pinyin: Tā suī shòu zhòngshāng, què yīkào jiān rèn de lǚ tǐngzhí shēntǐ.
examples.english: Despite his severe injuries, he relies on his resilient spine to keep his body upright.
